question: What is the practice adopted by Hindus of engaging in lifelong monasticism in order to achieve Moksha at the last stage of their lives?
explanation: There is a range of rituals and practice in Hinduism rituals such as puja (worship) and recitations (japa) and meditation (dhyana) to realize divine goals. During the last stage of their lives, some Hindus leave their social world and material possessions to engage in lifelong Sannyasa (monasticism) in order to achieve Moksha (salvation).
